metadata.feature_description: Provides adaptive user interface that works across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.

steps.expected: PersonaBar UI should display properly at desktop resolution with full navigation visible
steps.actual: PersonaBar displayed as compact sidebar (~80px) on left with icons. Full horizontal navigation menu (HOME, OUR PRODUCTS, NEWS, COMMUNITY) visible. Website content properly laid out with 4-column product grid.

steps.expected: UI should adapt for tablet with responsive navigation
steps.actual: PersonaBar sidebar remained visible. Navigation collapsed to 'Menu' button. Content reflows to 2-column grid. Text wraps appropriately.

steps.action: Clicked Menu button to expand collapsed navigation
steps.expected: Navigation menu should expand showing all menu items
steps.actual: Menu expanded showing vertical dropdown with HOME, OUR PRODUCTS, NEWS, COMMUNITY links

steps.expected: UI should be fully responsive at mobile viewport
steps.actual: PersonaBar sidebar remains visible on left (takes significant space). Menu button collapsed. Content stacks vertically, text wraps appropriately.

steps.action: Opened PersonaBar Dashboard panel at mobile viewport
steps.expected: Panel should adapt to mobile width
steps.actual: PersonaBar panel takes most of viewport width. Analytics warning dialog is partially cut off - only showing truncated text 'Analy... correct... the DNN'. Panel does not fully adapt to narrow mobile width.

issues: PersonaBar panel content (dialogs) can be cut off at mobile viewport widths, affecting usability

steps.expected: UI should adapt to landscape orientation
steps.actual: PersonaBar sidebar visible. More horizontal content visible. Menu button present. Layout adapts to wider but shorter viewport.

steps.expected: UI should display appropriately for tablet landscape
steps.actual: PersonaBar sidebar visible. Menu button present (navigation collapsed). 3-column product grid. Content adapts properly.

steps.action: Tested at standard 1280x720 viewport (100% zoom baseline)
steps.expected: UI should display properly at standard laptop resolution
steps.actual: PersonaBar sidebar visible. Full horizontal navigation displayed. 4-column product grid. All content properly proportioned.

steps.expected: UI should adapt to reduced effective viewport from zoom
steps.actual: Layout adapts similar to tablet view. PersonaBar sidebar visible. Navigation collapses to Menu button. Content reflows appropriately.

steps.action: Verified navigation menu collapse behavior across breakpoints
steps.expected: Navigation should collapse to hamburger/Menu button below certain breakpoint
steps.actual: At widths below approximately 1025px, horizontal navigation collapses to a 'Menu' button. Clicking Menu button reveals vertical dropdown menu with all navigation items.

steps.action: Tested responsive breakpoints across multiple viewport sizes
steps.expected: CSS media queries should trigger appropriate layout changes at defined breakpoints
steps.actual: Breakpoints observed: 1920x1080 (desktop, full nav, 4-col), 1280x720 (desktop, full nav, 4-col), 1024x768 (tablet, Menu button, 3-col), 768x1024 (tablet, Menu button, 2-col), 375x667 (mobile, Menu button, 1-col). Code confirms media queries at min-height:620px and 768px-1024px width range.

observations: PersonaBar sidebar always remains visible regardless of viewport size - it does not collapse or hide on mobile devices. This consumes significant horizontal space on narrow mobile screens.
Code in evoq.js shows responsive breakpoint handling for social tasks panel at 1024px and 768px widths, but this panel is hidden per CONTENT-8436.
CSS media query at min-height:620px adjusts user avatar positioning for shorter screens.
CSS media query targeting 768px-1024px width range adjusts dashboard header styling (font sizes, padding, margins).
Touch/tablet device detection uses CSS classes (.mac, .touch, .safari) for device-specific styling like removing iOS select styles.
PersonaBar panels (like Site Analytics Dashboard) do not fully adapt their content/dialogs to very narrow mobile viewports, potentially causing content to be cut off.
